column5: Well it was another successful trip in the St Marys Rapids today. Lots of steelies amist the cluster of spawning Kings. Then I landed this hog. To me a bit to get him in thought for sure it was an Atlantic and didn't even occur to be that it may be a brown till I showed the pic to my buddy. I didn't even bother looking at the tail since I thought it was an Atlantic. Anyone want to give me some advice as to whether this could be a brown? I would imagine the rare Atlantic would still be lurking but I know there are Browns as well in the St Marys.
I know eh you could throw a spawn bag on it and use it as a hook
Half brown, half atlantic, half gar... brownatlanticgar!  Can't help you on the ID but damn that is one funny looking fish.
Im gonna go with atlantic in spawning/winter colours...      TDunn
Agreed on Atlantic, and, that is one crazy ass kype on that dude!
that's one ugly brute!  hoping the crowds of chinnies dies down so the crowds of chinny anglers goes with them.
I would have thought brown but I'm not an expert. Amazing looking fish, my first thought was that it had a yap like a gar.  Kool catch!
haha that thing is uggly, good catch tho
Apart from the kype I'd say it's a prime fish!!  WTG dude.
Graveyard hole atlantic...a few winters ago they were hitting way better than steelhead especially in the CDN Hole
!!! I gotta get me one of those! In my two trips to the SOO I've caught nothing but pinks. :/
Thats a really great Atlantic. Great job!
Can't wait, we'll hit up the big huron steelies after the boots die!
Looks like a brown.... but nice Atlantic Leechman
